author: Staff Reporter
text:
Five Forest Department employees (standing) from Tirupur who bagged the award. Principal Chief Conservator of Forests N. Krishnakumar (third from left) and other senior officials are in the picture.

Five Forest Department employees from Tirupur bagged cash awards and citations as ‘rewards for excellence’ from Wildlife Crime Control Bureau for seizing skin of a tiger, leopard and barking deer from a six-member gang which allegedly tried to sell them at Udumalpet.

Forester C. Sivakumar, forest guard-cum-driver K. Kalimuthu and anti-poaching watchers Angu Kumar, B. Prakash and P. Narashimmaraj received cash awards and citations from Principal Chief Conservator of Forests N. Krishnakumar recently.

District Forest Officer A. Periasamy told The Hindu that the five men acted on intelligence gathered from various sources about the planned trade of animal skin and arrested Moideen Basha (30), who ran an eatery at Udumalpet, and five others in December 2015.

The arrest initially helped the officials to seize only a tiger skin. Further inquiry led to the seizure of leopard and barking deer skin too from a house, the officials said.
title: Foresters from Tirupur get award
